reference_pointers.pl_string: Benzothiazole derivatives have been extensively studied in drug chemistry1,2 and they exhibit diverse activities such as antitubercular3, antimicrobial4–6, antimalarial7, anticonvulsant8, antioxidant9, antidiabetic10, antitumor11, carbonic anhydrase (CA)12, and tryptase inhibitors13. Moreover, benzothiazole moieties are also found in fluorescent pH indicators14, iminocoumarin based zinc sensors15, bioluminogenic agent16,17, vulcanisation process of rubber18 and ligands for transition metal catalysts19.

Moreover, benzothiazole moieties are also found in fluorescent pH indicators14, iminocoumarin based zinc sensors15, bioluminogenic agent16,17, vulcanisation process of rubber18 and ligands for transition metal catalysts19.
